wormbase 0.2.4
  • Reference

Best BLASTP Hits

Source: R/blastp.R
blastp.Rd

Best BLASTP Hits

blastp(version = NULL, dir = ".")

Arguments

version

WormBase version. If NULL, defaults to current production release version available on the WormBase website. Legacy versions can be specified as a string (e.g. "WS262").
dir

Output directory.

Value

tbl_df grouped by wormpep column.

Examples

x <- blastp()
#> Files in directory:
#>  [1] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.CDS_transcripts.fa.gz"        
#>  [2] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.annotations.gff2.gz"          
#>  [3] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.annotations.gff3.gz"          
#>  [4] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.assembly.agp.gz"              
#>  [5] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.best_blastp_hits.txt.gz"      
#>  [6] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.canonical_geneset.gtf.gz"     
#>  [7] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.ests.fa.gz"

#> [16] "c_elegans.PRJNA13758.WS267.transposon_transcripts.fa.gz"
